Metadata: Fish infected with "Sphaerospora" spp. Thelohan (Myxosporea) from waters enzootic for proliferative kidney disease of salmonids

Epizootiologicaâ€‹l studies of PKD (proliferative kidney disease) at a hatchery in California resulted in the examination of non-salmonid fishes in the water supply as possible sources of PKX. This report describes "Sphaerospora" spp. parasitizing non-salmonid fish and rainbow trout, "Salmo gairdneri", and discusses their possible relationship to PKX, the causative agent of PKD in salmonid fish.
